page.title: 13Plenmeller Farm Haltwhistle.
page.content: East Plenmeller Farm is a{mixed {hill farm}of two thousand acres. 300 acres are grass park for grazing the animals. It is 600 feet above sea level at the river side, and 1020 feet above sea level on the fells. The crops are silage and hay to feed the cows in winter. There are twenty eight acres of{barley}and twenty acres of{turnips. There are one hundred Angus cross Friesian cows that are kept for fattening, 700 Swaledale sheep for selling and breeding replacement, 40 mules, a blonde D'Aquitaine bull, and five sheep dogs. The farmer has a lot of Fantail pigeons as well, and raises red grouse on the moors. He gives our school an enormous Christmas tree every year from the woods around the farm.
